channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Flytipping, 17th August
item.description:
Fly tipping under the tree on corner of Parkwood with Copers Cope Road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Copers Cope Road, New Beckenham, London

item.title: Temporary traffic lights not working, 17th August
item.description:
Traffic lights aren’t working and difficult to see if its safe to go as one whole lane is closed and the road works start round a corner.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crystal Palace Park Road, Crystal Palace, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large holes across the entire carriage way, 17th August
item.description:
I have reported this back in January 2025 and the road is still a danger, the entire carriage way has large holes across it. I cycle round this everyday onto the otherside of the road if I can, if I ride through it I am likely to damage my bike or even worse come off. The defect is outside 119 mayplace road east, opposite the bus stop. This is truely appalling that nothing has been done, and it’s only a matter of time before cars are damaged and putting an insurance claim in against bexley. It would also appear that my previous reports along with several others have been removed from your website indicating that the matter has been resolved.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mayplace Road East, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Locals are dumping waste including asbestos, 17th August
item.description:
Locals are dumping openly building waste including asbestos the area of tree bank needs a full cleaning as it is becoming a health hazard

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mollison Avenue, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Missing parking signs, 17th August
item.description:
Dear Southwark, The parking permit sign has been removed (I assume by someone naughty). Please can you replace it? Since the sign removal, we have had a large amount of inappropriate parking outside our house which is making it dangerous and very hard to park ourselves. Many thanks, Thomas
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bermondsey Wall East, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large amount of Cardboard & Bags of rubbish dumped on Picardy Road Belvedere DA17 near the 401/469 Bus Stop, 17th August
item.description:
A large quantity of cardboard & bags of rubbish have been dumped by the litter bin near the 401/469 Bus Stop on Picardy Road Belvedere DA17, approximately 25 metres from the junction with Halt Robin Road. Would arrangements be put in place to remove the rubbish as soon as practical.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Picardy Road, Lower Belvedere, London

item.title: Water issuing from ground, 17th August
item.description:
Water issuing fast from gaps in the ground paving in the front garden, then flowing onto the path and into the flood. A lot of water being wasted. Although on private land, it can't be a coincidence that there are other issues along the same road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 74, Crayford Road, Crayford, Dartford
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Removed bollard left on side of road, 17th August
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Westbury Road, Woodside Park, London

item.title: Tree foliage overhanging footpath, 17th August
item.description:

item.title: Glass and debris on the road, 17th August
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 15, Tillingham Way, Woodside Park, London
